title: Associate Director, Sponsorship Sales and Partner Marketing

description:
Our Opportunity

If you possess a rock-star proficiency in event-based sponsorship sales, a keen understanding of technology clients, and a drive for delivering exceptional results, join us in revolutionizing event sponsorship experiences.

As the Associate Director of Sponsorship Sales and Partner Marketing (SSPM), your focus will be on development and executing impactful programs for a wide range of clients. Leading the team in both fulfillment and sales, you will take charge of managing sales consulting, strategy and logistics for sponsoring partners throughout the entire event lifecycle.

This role is hybrid out of one of our office locations (New York, Boston, Detroit, Austin, Nashville, Los Angeles, or San Francisco).

Job Functions/ Responsibilities

Project Management
• Manage cross functional work streams and key stakeholders to ensure that all sponsorship benefits are fulfilled, including but not limited to: Event Technology, General Service Contractor & Other Vendors (i.e. Electrical, Rigging, Labor), Expo Show Floor Management, Content, Registration, Housing, Marketing and Demand Generation, Food & Beverage, Live Production, Security, Operations, Graphics and Creative Teams.
• Be a pillar and leader on the sponsorship team while directly managing direct reports.
• Establish and maintain a project plan alongside vendors and third party agencies to identify pertinent deadlines and deliverables for sponsors and ensure all benefits are executed in a timely manner.
• Build and manage the exhibitor portal tool (i.e. Rainfocus, Cvent, Swoogo, etc. )
• Ability to review floorplans and provide succinct feedback on how to give sponsors the best attendee flow.
• Daily reporting on sponsorship asset delivery to ensure sponsors are meeting event deadlines.
• Onsite escalations to ensure the delivery of a successful event.

Sales & Strategy
• Lead prospectus consulting and development, crafting compelling materials to attract sponsors and exhibitors.
• Design and execute a sales program specifically tailored for tech clients, ensuring operational fulfillment and a focus on surpassing sponsorship revenue goals.
• Identify fresh opportunities for sponsors aligned with the client's culture and event needs.
• Implement effective tracking mechanisms to evaluate the impact and success of sponsorships.
• Onboard and lead a dynamic sales team.
• Manage the onsite sales suite for sponsorship renewals and relationship building.
• Collaborate closely with sponsors to define and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) for Return on Investment (ROI).
• Analyze data and provide valuable insights to sponsors regarding their ROI.
• Contribute to new business development through innovative sponsorship initiatives.

Your Skills
• 5-7 years of proven experience in partnership management, sponsorship operations, and logistics.
• Strong experience in sponsorship sales while receiving high scores on sponsor and client surveys, with proven achievement in robust resign results (when applicable).
• Excellent organizational and project management skills, paying meticulous attention to both logistical and administrative details.
• Knowledge of and proficiency in the following rools: Cvent, RainFocus, Smartsheets, Google Suite, CRM Programs, Adobe Illustrator, and web-based project management tools
• Ability to develop versatile tools that can be repurposed for future events or other client engagements..
• Experience leading a team of professionals who are working as a team, sharing ideas, best practices, and lessons learned in order to continually improve.

Your Competencies

Deliver-Produce with excellence, in all your areas you touch directly or indirectly, for the client, the project you are assigned, and the GPJ team.

Initiative: Spon. Sales & Partner Mktg-Be a proactive consultant and clear communicator at all times to your direct client and partner contacts and GPJ team. Able to package, converse and persuade key clients and end partners of the benefits of participation in the sponsorship.

Solution Oriented: Spon. Sales & Partner Mktg-Focus on the desired outcome and be ready with multiple solutions in order to reach the end goal. Be mindful of the balance between providing unique sponsorship experiences and the cost savings to our clients.

Versatile: Spon. Sales & Partner Mktg-Willing to understand client contracts, procurement requirements and supplier code of conduct, scope and work with the client, and when necessary adapt to any situation in order to complete the task at hand. Action oriented and approach work with a "can do" attitude. When necessary, adapt to any situation in order to complete the task at hand.

Salary Range: $110,000 – $130,000

Salary is dependent on a variety of factors including (but not limited to) experience, skills, and location.

Who We Are

GPJ is the world leader in experiential marketing. Our 29 global offices are filled with fearless people dreaming up ideas that are transforming industries and bringing the most respected brands to life in powerfully, exciting ways. We are a part of the Project Worldwide family. An independent, employee-owned global network of complementary, wholly-owned agencies.

You read that "employee-owned" part, right? You heard us correctly. You work hard, she works hard, we all work hard… we all succeed and reap the rewards. We have an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) – providing our employees with an ownership interest. We thought you would want to know that. In fact, there is a lot more you would want to know about us, like our FTO policy (no more "accruing" time off) only to be included if applicable, our employer matching 401(k) plan (no vesting period), our "no employee contribution" healthcare option. But we are getting ahead of ourselves here, let's talk about this exciting opportunity first and we can fill you in on our perks & benefits later.

GPJ is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation and gender identity), national origin, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected class. In addition to federal law requirements, GPJ complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. GPJ expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on any protected class.
